metadata.title: CVE-2019-9817 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Images from a different domain can be read using a canvas object in some circumstances. This could be used to steal image data from a different site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
